title: 17 Mimosa Recipes to Brighten Your Brunch
description: Find mimosa ideas for a brunch buzz, such as our Basic Mimosa and Fresh Pineapple Mimosas. Get the easy and delicious mimosa recipes here.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 17 Mimosa Recipes to Brighten Your Brunch By Corey Williams Corey Williams Corey Williams is a food writer for MyRecipes and Allrecipes. She has a decade of journalism experience. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on August 10, 2021 Close Credits: bd.weld Looking for a brunch buzz? You're in the right place! We've rounded up our favorite mimosas that you'll want to try ASAP. Whether it's morning, noon, or night, a Champagne cocktail is never a bad idea. From the basic 2-ingredient mix you know and love to creative twists on the classic drink, you'll want to bookmark this collection of our best mimosa recipes ⁠— you'll come back to it again and again. 01 of 18 Fresh Pineapple Mimosa View Recipe Save France C Don't let your fresh pineapple go to waste! Use the juice to mix up these flavorful mimosas made with diced fruit, triple sec, and chilled dry sparkling wine. 02 of 18 Pineapple Apricot Mimosas View Recipe Save fabeveryday Apricot nectar, pineapple juice, and frozen orange juice concentrate work together beautifully in this big-batch Champagne cocktail. 10 Easy Big-Batch Cocktails for a Brunch Buzz 03 of 18 Christmas Mimosa View Recipe Save Soup Loving Nicole Have a holly jolly holiday with this cranberry juice mimosa garnished with fresh rosemary and sugared cranberries. 04 of 18 Apple Cider Mimosa View Recipe Save Sandra Garth Looking for a cozy cocktail for your next autumn brunch? Try this cinnamon-spiked drink made with apple cider and Champagne. 05 of 18 Cranberry-Pomegranate Mimosa View Recipe Save Chef Mo "These cranberry-pomegranate mimosas are great for your holiday get-togethers and cocktail parties, or for just spreading holiday cheer," says recipe creator Melinda. 06 of 18 Holiday Mimosa View Recipe Save Katie S Here's another festive mimosa for the holiday season. Orange liqueur takes the traditional recipe up a notch, while a sugared rim adds irresistible sweetness. 15 Easy Christmas Cocktails 07 of 18 Party Mimosa View Recipe Save dustysun This crowd-pleasing drink comes together in just 10 minutes and serves a whopping 15 people, so it's the perfect addition to your next low-key party menu. 08 of 18 Pineapple Sunrise Mimosas View Recipe Save Allrecipes Magazine How gorgeous is this restaurant-worthy mimosa? Make sure to refrigerate the pineapple, orange, and lime juices together overnight to allow the flavors to meld. 09 of 18 Pomosa View Recipe Save A colorful take on the Mimosa. Photo by House of Aqua. You need just two ingredients to make this simple cocktail: pomegranate juice and Champagne. For extra flair, add a teaspoon of pomegranate seeds at the end. 10 of 18 Apricot Mango Mimosas for a Crowd View Recipe Save Photo by thedailygourmet. This cocktail, a fizzy blend of sparkling rosé and apricot-mango juice, is easy to make and even easier to drink. 11 of 18 Mimosa View Recipe Save bd.weld You can't go wrong with a classic. Make this easy cocktail with just two ingredients. "Excellent drink, a must for any special occasion," says reviewer CHIEFXCEL21. 12 of 18 Pink Mimosa View Recipe Save Chef Mo These easy, vibrant mimosas will be a hit at your next brunch. Peach schnapps adds fruity flavor and an extra kick. 13 of 18 Hawaiian Mimosas View Recipe Save Chef Mo This easy coconut rum-Champagne cocktail "will make you think you're on a beach in paradise," according to recipe creator Laura. 25 Sizzling Summer Cocktails That Will Keep You Cool 14 of 18 Blood Orange Mimosa View Recipe Save fabeveryday Blood orange juice gives this pineapple juice mimosa bright flavor and color. The pink sanding sugar on the rim is the perfect finishing touch. 15 of 18 Strawberry-Pineapple Mimosas View Recipe Save Tammy Lynn This is a "delicious twist on a mimosa," according to reviewer Tammy Lynn. "I liked having the sliced strawberries in the glass with the drink." 6 Most Refreshing Strawberry Cocktails 16 of 18 Pear Mimosa View Recipe Save Chef Mo Sparkling pear cider is a delicious stand-in for orange juice in this 2-ingredient drink. Recipe creator Kris Swiggum says it works just as well with peach or apple cider. 17 of 18 Fruity Company Mimosa View Recipe Save Chef Mo Make this party-perfect cocktail for a crowd with just apricot nectar, pineapple juice, a can of frozen orange juice concentrate, and a bottle of Champagne. 18 of 18 More Inspiration foodelicious Try one of our Best Cocktails for Spring Brunches. Plus, explore our entire collection of Cocktail Recipes. Grilled Grapefruit Paloma Cocktail Earl Greyhound Mexican Strawberry Water (Agua de Fresa) Explore more: Recipes Drinks Recipes Cocktail Recipes Champagne Drinks Recipes Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
